intro: Hasseanthus blochmaniae subsp. insularis, commonly known as the Galápagos hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid climate of its habitat. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are usually pink or red in color. Its leaves are broad and glossy, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
